Public NotInheritable Class TransformModel Implements ITransformModel

Docs.summary: This encapsulates zero or more transform models. It does this by recording the initial schema, together with the sequence of transforms applied to that schema.

public Microsoft.ML.Data.Schema InputSchema { get; }
.property instance class Microsoft.ML.Data.Schema InputSchema
Public ReadOnly Property InputSchema As Schema
member this.InputSchema : Microsoft.ML.Data.Schema

Docs.summary: The input schema that this transform model was originally instantiated on. Note that the schema may have columns that aren't needed by this transform model. If an IDataView exists with this schema, then applying this transform model to it shouldn't fail because of column type issues. REVIEW: Would be nice to be able to trim this to the minimum needed somehow. Note however that doing so may cause issues for composing transform models. For example, if transform model A needs column X and model B needs Y, that is NOT produced by A, then trimming A's input schema would cause composition to fail.

MemberSignature.Value: public Microsoft.ML.Data.Schema OutputSchema { get; }
.property instance class Microsoft.ML.Data.Schema OutputSchema
Public ReadOnly Property OutputSchema As Schema
member this.OutputSchema : Microsoft.ML.Data.Schema

Docs.summary: The resulting schema once applied to this model. The might have columns that are not needed by this transform and these columns will be seen in the produced by this transform.
